intro: Smilax aberrans subsp. retroflexa, commonly known as the red-berried smilax, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, spiny leaves, and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its berries are usually red when mature and are an important food source for various wildlife species. This subspecies is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and thickets.
